title: Add Zen model support to sprite-launch
description:
OpenCode Zen is a curated model gateway. The OPENCODE_ZEN_API_KEY env var flows through .env to sprites already (all 26 ports source .env before opencode run). But sprite-launch could be enhanced to:

1. Accept MODEL=zen/<model-name> and auto-configure Zen
2. Validate Zen API key presence when Zen model requested
3. Show available Zen models in --help output
4. Document Zen setup in each port's README

title: Add test results table to ports/tests/README.md
description: The test results table was removed from README.md during cleanup. Add a generated/updated table showing all 26 ports and their test status (25/26 pass, Odin pending). Include columns: Port, Sprite Name, Poems Written, Status.

title: Standardize beads install URL across all 26 ports
description:
Some ports use https://beads.dev/install.sh, others use https://raw.githubusercontent.com/steveyegge/beads/main/scripts/install.sh. Since beads.dev DNS fails on sprites, standardize all to the GitHub raw URL. Also add 'command -v bd >/dev/null 2>&1 ||' guard to skip install if already present.

Ports to check: all 26 under ports/. Grep for 'beads.*install' in each launch file.

title: Fix beads.dev DNS resolution on sprites
description: The beads.dev domain fails DNS resolution from inside sprites. The Odin port was updated to use the GitHub raw URL instead (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/steveyegge/beads/main/scripts/install.sh). Other ports may have the same issue if they switch to beads.dev URL. Consider standardizing all ports on the GitHub URL, or fixing DNS on sprites.

title: Add automated test runner for all ports
description:
Create a test script that launches all 26 ports in parallel (or batches), polls for completion, pulls results, and generates a report. Could reuse sprite-watch or implement direct polling. Would make re-testing after fixes much easier.

Current manual workflow: build port -> launch sprite -> wait -> check poems -> pull -> commit. All of this could be automated.

title: Complete Odin port poem test
description:
The Odin port code is fixed and builds, but the poem test has not succeeded. The opencode big-pickle model keeps creating todo lists without writing files. Need to retry with a different free model (gpt-5-nano, glm-4.7-free, kimi-k2.5-free) or wait and retry big-pickle later.

Code fixes applied:
- git init now includes add+commit
- beads install checks for existing bd, uses GitHub raw URL (beads.dev DNS fails on sprites)
- watch poll interval 5s
- run_capture uses fread for reliable EOF
- CHECKPOINT_INTERVAL warns on invalid input

Build requires: mise install odin@dev-2026-02, then ODIN_ROOT set to mise path

title: Investigate opencode big-pickle reliability for poem tasks
description:
The big-pickle free model frequently fails the poem test: it creates todo lists but never makes tool calls to write files. Observed on Odin sprite twice in a row. Other models (used via common-lisp and haxe sprites) also exit with code 137 (OOM killed) but at least complete the poems first.

Consider:
- Testing all free models (big-pickle, gpt-5-nano, glm-4.7-free, kimi-k2.5-free) for reliability
- Adding retry logic to sprite-launch
- Documenting which models work best for simple tasks

title: Add sprite-watch integration for poem tests
description: Currently poem tests require manual polling (sprite exec to check files). Could enhance the test workflow to use sprite-watch with beads to auto-detect completion. Would need the plan template to include beads task creation, or have the test harness create a beads task before launching the agent.
